questions.question_text:
A security team informs the Linux administrator that a specific server is acting as an open relay.
To which of the following is the security team referring?

choices.A: The server is running the SSH service and is open to the Internet, allowing outside sources to log into the server without source IP address filtering.
choices.B: The server is acting as an unmanaged router, open to the Internet, and is allowing outside Internet traffic into the network with no filtering.
choices.C: The server is acting as a web proxy and allowing outside unauthenticated sources to connect to the server, effectively hiding the source's IP address for malicious activities.
choices.D: The server has an email service configured to allow outside sources to send email to other external parties on the Internet without validation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D:
Open Relay = email

Selected Answer: D
D. High disk activity
iostat shows high disk write rate to sda
sar shows high iowait percentages (higher than user percentages)
free shows most RAM is used for buffers/cache which indicates high utilisation as data is read from or written to disk.

choices.C: User processes have taken up all the available CPU time

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct
>arp -a
Interface: 10.0.0.28 --- 0x12
 Internet Address Physical Address Type
 10.0.0.1 78-d2-94-33-40-30 dynamic

questions.question_text:
A Linux administrator needs to know the MAC address of the server's gateway.
Which of the following commands should the administrator run to obtain this information?

choices.A: Killing the parent process with -15 gives it a chance to kill all of the child processes.
choices.C: The -15 signal tells the kill command to kill all processes matching the Apache string.
choices.B: The -15 signal will allow the kill command to automatically seek out all child processes and kill them as well.
choices.D: The -15 signal gracefully kills the process and all Its parent and child processes.

comments.content: Try to kill with it child process, it will not kill parent one.

discussion.content: D. The -15 signal gracefully kills the process and all Its parent and child processes.
It's C, because they explicitly mentioned they were destroying and rebuilding VM's with a script

C is correct, using scripts to deploy infrastructure, this article mentions consistency too which the question also hints at

https://stackify.com/what-is-infrastructure-as-code-how-it-works-best-practices-tutorials/

The answer is C. The keyword in this question is "Version Control". Thats the giveaway...
https://www.redhat.com/en/topics/automation/what-is-infrastructure-as-code-iac

comments.content:
Changed my mind:
Orchestration addresses the requirement to provision environments at a higher level than configuration management. The focus here is on coordinating configuration across complex environments and clusters.

discussion.content: I think it's C: Infrastructure as code is the process of managing and provisioning computer data centers through machine-readable definition files, rather than physical hardware configuration or interactive configuration tools.

Selected Answer: C
The benefit of employing infrastructure as code techniques is that the process of deploying the app and its environment can be easily automated ( infrastructure automation ).
You can certainly have orchestration without automation, but often a primary goal of orchestration is to automate the process.
The Right Answer is B. Automation is part of the orchestration.

questions.question_text:
A systems administration team has decided to treat their systems as immutable instances. They keep the desired state of each of their systems in version control and apply automation whenever they provision a new instance. If there is an issue with one of their servers, instead of troubleshooting the issue, they terminate the instance and rebuild it using automation.
Which of the following is this an example of?
